Reviews.Title: “Just turn around”
Reviews.Author: nylike2travel
Reviews.Content: We ended up at this Hotel due to our travel agent . We were three women with luggage, I opened the door and to my right was a single bed against a filthy wall I turned around to my girlfriends and said "we are Not staying here"! There was a queen bed in the middle, all the walls were filthy, the rug was equally filthy there was a small Filthy t.v from the year of the flood on a table . Everywhere we looked the in that room the lampshades, the chair by the desk had crumbs all over it. In a big nutshell if you want to feel like you are in a filthy frat house by all means go enjoy , we found a wonderful place not much further away and we SAVED money!

Reviews.Title: “An efficient hotel in a handy location”
Reviews.Author: PennyCrayon87
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived, the man at the front desk was friendly and welcoming (as were all the staff we encountered) and we didn't have to wait long at all to get into our room. The room was on the same floor as the reception, right at the front of the building...next to the busy road, which was noisy (even at night). So after very little sleep, the next day we decided to ask if there were other rooms available - and we were moved very quickly, to a much nicer room; there was no traffic noise, the bathroom was bigger -there was a shower AND a bath and it had a newer television. Food-wise, the breakfast was lovely, there were breads, butter, ham, sweet croissants, cereal, orange juice and a really good tasting coffee! We had booked half-board, so our meal in the evening was mainly various pastas in a cheese or tomato sauce, followed by a second dish (I recommend the cheese selection, comes with little pot of honey) and a side order of either salad or baked potatoes. There was only one night where we had to go somewhere else to eat, so we ventured round the corner to a place called La Baita in Via Lucania - wonderful little restaurant with reasonable prices (when you consider how expensive Rome can be!) I had a big pizza which cost me about 7 or 8 euros. The hotel was well situated for us; the Trevi Fountain, the Spanish Steps, Villa Borghese, a couple of metro stations and a supermarket (called Conad) were in a walkable distance and we even got to the Colosseum in good time. We went to Vatican City on the metro - and found that the Spagna metro station was the most straightforward to get to from the hotel. In the end, we got what we were looking for from Hotel Priscilla - it isn't grand, but the staff are friendly and its just what you need if, like us, you spend pretty much all day exploring the city and want somewhere clean and comfortable to rest your head at night. The only downside was our first room next to the street.

Reviews.Title: “Efficiency, not luxury. And great service.”
Reviews.Author: Gal V
Reviews.Content: I have read trough alot of reviews on this hotel. some are good, but some are really bad. Here are some points to consider: - If you are looking for a luxurious hotel - pay more. Rome is exepensive. -Hotel priscilla is not that pretty, the quallity of the facilities may not be great. -YOU DO GET a decent SHOWER and BED, and your room will get CLEANED EVERY DAY. -You CAN walk to almost any site (Rome is for walking, don't like walking? get a bus tour...). -If you get a room facing the street, there will be some noise (Bearable, not recommended for light-sleepers). -EXCELENT SERVICE, something that's not very common in most of Rome. -WIFI costs 5EURO for the whole stay and DOES NOT work in the room. -Breakfast is there only to fill you up a little before a long day. Not that satisfying but thats how they do breakfast in Rome (A few pastries, some bread, some cheese and ham). -All in all as said here before - a great base to tour Rome from - Nothing more and nothing less. Stayed for four nights, here is the summary: DAY1: Arrived to the hotel at about 9PM, very tired from the flight. We were immidietly welcomed with the wounderful smile of ALEX at the recception. Check in was quick and efficient, and as we did it we also got maps and directions to the colliseom (Bus line 63 for less than 5 minutes and 5 more minutes of walking). Had dinner at the hotel restorant, not amazing but very nice. DAY2: Line 63 to the Vittorio Emanuelle monument (you can walk there, but I have planned a route including all the MUST SEE places that we could see in one day), colliseom, palatino hill and the roman forum (all three of them = one ticket - 12EURO Pp). That part took us about 6 hours including lunch at a restorant. Than we crossed the Tevere river trough the little island in the middle and had coffee on the other side - very peacefull and nice - Highly recommended. Crossed back at the next bridge walked to campo the fiori, piazza navona, pantehon, fontana the trevi and finally the spanish steps (try to plan your walking so you'll pass by all of the little pictures in the tourist map, it's worth it). Went back by foot. Spanish steps to Priscilla - 15 minutes if you take the streets ABOVE the steps. All in all, that day took us anout 10 hours. Dinner was at a nice restorant in the area of piazza salustio (few blocks from the hotel). DAY3:Bus line 490 from piazza Fiume (3 minutes behind the hotel) to Ottavino street and less than 5 minutes to the Vatican. About 2 hours in the Vatican museum, s.Pietro square and basilica. By foot to Castel S.Angelo (The amazing view from the top is worth alot more than the 5 euro ticket), than walking on the river side and passing trough Cavour bridge, than by foot to piazza del Popolo (the 3 streets heading in to the centro turrico are loaded with places for shopping, eating and even some pubs). Via del babuino took us back to the spanish steps and again to the hotel. 7 Walking hours that day. For dinner we went back to "PizzaRe", near piazza del Popolo - very nice place. DAY4: That day was just about Roaming the streets of Rome (Sorry about the stupid pon). Started walking twards the termini station, the republica square is beatiful but not alot to do and not a very nice area. Had lunch at "Aramando Al Pantheon" a nice small place we were lucky enogh to get the last table that was not reserved ! It's just in front of the pantheon but it's sure not a tourist restorant (Stay away from these Usually they have English signs and people outside offering you to eat there as you walk by, food is OK but it's not great as the food in the less touristic places). That day took us about 6 hours of walking. For dinner we went to "Ristorante il Rifugio del Buttero" (if you face the hotels restorant it's the second resorant to the left). The only thing that we were sorry about is not going there for every lunch and dinner ! It is a very nice restorant/wine bar, not too exepensive and the food was simpley AMAZING ! Aspecially the beef T-bone steak. On day 5 we got up earlly had breakfast and straight to the airport (flight was at noon). So, as you can see me and my gf can walk alot, we're in our earlly 20's. If thats not your king of tour you might consider paying extra for a closser hotel. For us, this hotel was all we needed. Again I want to mention the great great service by all of the staff (And I work at a 5 stars hotel in Israel so I know good service when I see it) and a special thanks to ALEX which was very helpful and nice! BTW, sorry about some of my English mistakes, it is not my native languagh.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel maybe for budget conscious”
Reviews.Author: Shopntravel_more
Reviews.Content: Its not far to get to from the termini station (the main one) by bus. Had no sense of direction so had trouble working out where it was when we got off our stop. Hotel itself is in a reasonably ok location for getting around to the sites - note nothing in walking distance - have to either catch a bus or walk 20 minutes to the metro but then metro is quick to sites like Colisseum. The hotel has a nice reception, mediocre bed rooms with single beds that don't leave much room for turning over in. It has the tiniest shower (can fit you with about an inch either side) and not much more room for anything else. Our room overlooked the street and there was a lot of noise at night when trying to get sleep. The breakfast was reasonable, what you would expect for continental breakfast - cakes were nice. I probably wouldn't stay here again as the shower size was not a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is DISGUSTING!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cutebugtravels12345
Reviews.Content: Stay here if: You like MOLD growing on the walls and ceiling. You don't want beds - you want spring loaded cots pushed together in the middle of the room. You want to be miles from any sites or public transportation- and UP hill. You don't want basic cleanliness. You want to read fake reviews or lists of amenities that are not provided. I booked this hotel based on trip advisor reviews only to show up and realize that it is OBVIOUS that the staff is writing FAKE positive reviews. This place does NOT deserve the label "hotel"- this is a motel at best (and that's being generous). Save your money and stay at a free hostel for the same quality. Parts of our room were literally held together with tape! Apparently there was a fire as the vents had black stains smearing the ceiling. Mold growing on walls and ceilings of the bathroom and room itself. It's horrifying to see the modern decor of the lobby then to be taken to your smelly cot. This hotel is loud. Uncomfortable. Miles from any convienence. If you make the mistake of booking like we did BE WARNED! You cannot cancel. You are forced to pay for the entire stay even if you leave and don't stay here. This place ruined a dream vacation we planned for years. Don't let this happen to you.

Reviews.Title: “2 star but the staff make it 3!”
Reviews.Author: Live4Hols72
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a short stay with my wife and 14 month old baby. If travelling with a young child I would suggest you request a quiet room when booking. We didn't but they knew we had a young child as had arranged for a travel cot in the room. They placed us on the 1st floor overlooking the street and the noise was unbelievable. We asked for a room change but were told one was only available for our last day/night, so we didn't bother. On the whole though the staff were extrememly helpful and spoke good english and helped with our luggage when we arrived. They always smiled and were pleased to help with any little question. The room (119) was in desperate need of updating with staining and peeling paint. Bedsheets were clean but very worn as was the furniture. Yes I know it doesn't matter that much on a short trip when you're out most of the day but you can't escape the fact it's a bit grim. Shower was good and hot so no complaints there. Appeared to be air con but this didn't work either - the room was far too hot and we struggled to get the temperature down, so we slept on top of the sheets. The location is of the hotel is fine, situated on the north east part of the city, but everything is accessible on foot - we managed to get to Vatican City and back in a day, with a pushchair, and see loads in between (Trevi, Pantheon etc). We had a great 1st trip to this city and would love to go back, but I doubt very much we'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a run down gentlemans hostel”
Reviews.Author: Polar_bear77
Reviews.Content: I has taken me over 9 months to write this review because i felt i would be too harsh if i wrote it straight after visiting. My feelings are unchanged. The rooms were run down and the shower didn't drain properly and the toilet seat was broken. I did not feel safe staying in this hotel with my children. I did not book this hotel it was done through my travel agent. They copt a mouthful about this hotel too.

Reviews.Title: “Priscilla, Queen of Rome!!”
Reviews.Author: Nancy_W_77
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Rome and I really had no idea of where exactly to stay. Priscilla turned out to be an excellent choice. The room I was in was small but reasonable for a a single traveller but best of all it was very clean and kept this way for the entirety of my stay there. The staff were friendly and helpful considering my very limited English. In terms of location I walked a lot of places from here and it was close to buses to the Termini so therefore easy to get on the metro. The breakfast in the restaurant was nice and simple, but plenty to start the day. I had dinner from the restaurant a few times and it was quick and tasty. The wi if was a bit on and off but generally they fixed it au quickly. Would definitely come and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Priscilla Hotel--Stayed twice on trip”
Reviews.Author: drkjdr
Reviews.Content: On a busy street, the Priscilla is a clean and updated 3 star property. We found the desk staff helpful and everyone very nice. Location was very good for us. Some very good close restaurants and bus access. First stay we had older rooms on first level, which were comfortable and basic with noise from the street when windows were open. On our second stay new rooms on 2nd lever were open and brand new. While still basic, everything was fresh and new. Not quite as noisy as lower level, but required use of stairs due to single slow elevator. They held our bags while we travelled and had them waiting in our rooms upon return. We enjoyed our stay

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Asheysmommy2005
Reviews.Content: Our flight from the US arrived in Rome around 7:30 am. By the time we passed through customs, and traffic getting to the hotel, it was around 9-10am. Although our room was not ready, we were able to leave our bags in the lobby and were encouraged to explore the city. Check in was very friendly and the man at the reception desk was very friendly and gave us a map of the city. When we arrived back to the hotel at 11:30, he informed us that our room was ready. Our room was on the same floor as the lobby. I thought it was large for European standards! The bathroom was standard, sink, toliet, and a stand up single stall shower. Our room had a tv, we did not turn it on even once, we were in Rome on our honeymoon! The bed was hard as a rock, but again, I think this is a Eurpoean thing, wasn't concerned. We purchased the wifi for the week at a flat 5 Euros. The wifi didn't work in our room, but we did have a very strong signal right outside our door, so I sat on the bench right outside our room most mornings while my husband was getting ready and sent e-mails home. The housekeeping always did a fine job, we had no difficulties with them. The front desk staff was great, there was the man who checked us in the first day, a lady and an older gentleman. We had no problems with any of them except the older gentleman on the last day who gave me problems when trying to settle up on our final bill. We owed a total of 25 Euros, 5 from the wifi, and then the 2 Euro fee per person per day for 5 nights = 25Euros. They had the Visa logo posted right on their front desk, however he tried to tell me they didn't accept Visa, just cash. At that point, we only had enough Euros to tip the driver taking us to the airport, so it was the Visa or US Dollars. Finally, once my husband came into the reception area he backed down and took our Visa. The other 2 reception staff members were always very helpful helping us with which bus routes to take, and where to buy bus passes. Their English was very good as well. Rome seemed very big looking on the map, but once we were there walking around for a few days, we realized that it isn't too large, and most things are within walking distance as long as you have the time. We walked to the Spanish Steps, Trevi, Down to the Victor Emanuelle Monument (the wedding cake), Piazza Navona as well as Piazza del Popolo. The restaurant connected to the hotel was AMAZING! Truely the best food we'd ever tasted, and a great welcome on our first night in Rome. Unfortunatley, when we went to pay and tried using our Visa, we were given a hard time there as well, and ultimately ended up using 90 of the 130 Euros that we had budgeted for the whole trip since they wouldn't take the Visa. Knowing now what we didn't know then, we'd bring more cash, and not plan on using our Visa. We figured the Visa would be a better option as it is quick, and Visa woud take care of the exchange rate.

Reviews.Title: “I would go back!”
Reviews.Author: funkygibbon32
Reviews.Content: I was a little sceptical about arriving at this hotel after reading the reviews on here. However, I found the hotel to be charming. The reception staff were very friendly and perfect English which helped, as my Italian is less than poor! I was travelling with friends, and I had been allocated a single room. We had to laugh when I opened the door, as my room was really, really small with a single bed and bathroom. I found it comfortable enough for what I needed, as I was only there to sleep and shower. The walls have been decorated, but the main problem I noticed with the so called dirty walls, was that I could see where people had put dirty suitcases on the beds, and then rested them against the walls, so not really the managements fault. The rest of the room was clean, with a small fridge. The view overlooked a residential courtyard and had very little natural light. We had breakfast included in our package, which consisted of tea/coffee, cereals, juices, croissants, bread, ham and cheese. Which was enough for us. The lady who is in charge of the breakfast room was really nice, and welcoming and made a fuss of the child in our group. The hotel is conveniently located, a Conad supermarket is 5 - 10 min walk away, and the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain about 15 min walk away. We booked tickets on the Roma Cristiana hop on/off bus tour. 21euro for 48 hours and free for children. This tour stopped at all of the main attractions, and in my opinion the best way to see the city. Rome itself is a fascinating city, with lots to do and see. However, it is very expensive to eat and drink. We went to Piazza Navona, which is a lovely square, but very touristy, hence the prices. We shared a ham and cheese pizza, and had a bottle of water, and I had a 2 pint glass of beer, and it came to just under 50euros. Needless to say, it was the most sober I have been on a holiday. I would certainly go back to Hotel Priscilla. All in all, a friendly family run hotel, in a handy location. I look forward to going again in a few years.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and OK Value”
Reviews.Author: JMyersWirral
Reviews.Content: We stayed twice here over a two-week period for five days initially and then just a one-night stop over. The first stay was OK with a reasonable size room and bathroom but the second wasn't so good since althought he room was big with a king sized bed and two single beds the bathroom was really small and there was a destinctive smell of drains! If we had been staying longer on the second visit we would have insisted on another room. The hotel reception was very helpful and breakfast included a sensible range covering adequate food for most people and if there were particular requirements this was accommodated e.g. gluten free etc. The hotel is within the ancient city walls of Rome and about a 20 minute walk from Termini so it is easy to visit all the tourist sights. We ate in the hotel restaurant one night and the pasta and sweet were very good.

Reviews.Title: “Tired little hotel”
Reviews.Author: MetFireChief
Reviews.Content: The hotel was close to transport links, the staff were very friendly and helpful, and the one evening meal that we had was good. However, the room was a big letdown - it was chosen for us as part of an HF Holiday tour of Rome (reviewed seperately) for a four night stay. The sheets and towels were spotless and each day the room was cleaned really well. Unfortunately, the room's walls were the scruffiest I have seen, the decor was ancient and there was a really unacceptable level of noise from the street due to poorly performing 'double glazed' windows. In the bathroom, there was an unhealthy amount of black mould around the cistern; the shower never worked independently of the bath taps, and the whole impression for the room was of a neglected maintenance programme. A crucial feature to note is that there is only ONE FIRE EXIT down a communal staircase......

Reviews.Title: “More like 2 star - depends what room you get”
Reviews.Author: YourFriendInItaly
Reviews.Content: I have to start off by saying that the staff was very friendly and helpful. I arrived without a booking so asked if they had any rooms. They offered me a single room with double bed on the first floor. The room was horrible..dirty, old, scuff marks on the walls, old AC unit that barely worked,etc. so I asked for another room. Even though I was only staying one night there was no way I would stay in that room. Luckily, they moved me upstairs to a very nice and large room that must have recently been refurbished (was a triple room with king bed and 1 single). It was like being in a different hotel all together! So, beware of what room you book and it's probably worth paying more for a better room. There was some street noise since my room was facing the road but the AC worked well so I kept the windows closed and had a good night's sleep. As for location, it is not in the exact centre of town but it is close enough to get to all sights. Just about 20 minute walk to the top of the Spanish Steps and about 15 minutes or so to Villa Borghese. So, if you are looking for a budget option then Hotel Priscilla is a no frills option with nice staff. I am giving the rooms an 'average' rating only because the first room was horrible but the 2nd was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it”
Reviews.Author: Lila_redmond
Reviews.Content: Wat can I say, it's small but when I was in Rome all I needed was somewhere to shower change and sleep. The staff were lovely, sooo friendly and the food in the little place beside the hotel was to die for also the young man that ran the place was outstanding! Always had manors but wasn't a stiffneck either. Everything worked in my room bar 1 thing and that was the bathroom light but there was a light on the wall so we just used dat instead ha air conditioning was great as it was very warm over there . Staff always helped us book our tours and called us when we the bus came to pick us up. They all seemed like a big family and it's really nice to be around when your tired from being walking all day! I'm booking it again for next year I can't wait .

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Regis_Jundiai
Reviews.Content: Hotel without conservation, personal service very bad, no-clean hotel and insects

Reviews.Title: “will be back”
Reviews.Author: liamocaoim
Reviews.Content: room very clean beds changed every day staff frendly hotel could do with a good paint all over great wine kept out noise will go back

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quiet neighborhood - walking distance from Termini”
Reviews.Author: EK-STL
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through Air Berlin including flight and breakfast. We walked from Termini train station within 15 minutes. Bus stops around the corner from hotel. Not a lot of contact with reception by choice, we got our room keys and were told when/where breakfast was located in perfect English. Room was quite large for Europe. Carpet was old and needed to be replaced 5 years ago! It was January, so we did not test the air-conditioning. Stayed out all day and night, so did not test TV either. Bathroom was clean, water was hot. Breakfast left a lot to be desired, but for the price and location, it was fine for a cup of tea and bread with Nutella before heading out the door. US Embassy is nearby, so don't worry about the extra security and police cars around. It's always like that.

Reviews.Title: “PRiscilla----PRICED RIGHT-----”
Reviews.Author: GCSMaryland
Reviews.Content: Priscilla Hotel (3 star) is an extremely clean, well-situated hotel in a very safe clean neighborhood. The front desk was manned by very friendly, efficient and bilingual employees. Got wake-up call every morning on time. Room was clean with fresh toiletries and towels every day. Plenty hot water and fridge in room. 2 senior friends traveling so needed twin beds which were supplies. Extra bed in room if 3rd person travelling. Only drawback was some noise from traffic because room was in front of hotel. A plus was window could be opened for fresh air which we kept open partially. Heat was in great working order. Nothing fancy but basic and orderly. Buses 1/2 block away and restaurant in hotel was great (check my review seperately) Hotel, itself, was very quiet. Had elevator to all floors. Easy check-in and check-out. Would definately stay at the "Priscilla" again if on a return to Rome. Special kudos to "Adell" who worked 7 a.m. shift. He was truly Italian Hospitality at its finest. Hotel supplies continental breakfast also. 2 selections of juice, cerals, hard boiled eggs, coussants, selection of meat/cheese, bread or rolls, butter, jams, etc. Hot coffee/tea/expresso etc. "Stephania" was always happy and smiling continuously while she keep the breakfast room humming and replenishing everything as needed. Extremely hard working and an "asset" for the Hotel. Everything was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel, no frills, helpful staff, excellent resturant”
Reviews.Author: clarky_snr
Reviews.Content: We booked our 4 night stay when we booked our flights with Easyjet as an "all inclusive". So we were committed to this hotel before we saw where we were staying. I read these reviews before we arrived in Rome and, having stayed in hotels all over the world, especially the southern hemisphere, we arrived with an open mind. Our flight in was late arriving, and by the time we'd transferred, it was very late. The receptionist wasn't at allbothered by this, was expecting us, and made us feel very welcome. Our 3rd floor room was small, and so too the double bed - which had one side hard up against the wall, the room was so small. But it was clean, the toilet and shower worked, so too, the refrigerator and the TV, although we weren't in Rome to watch Italian TV. As it is the end of March, and although the temperature hit 22 degrees over the weekend, we didn't need the Aircon, didn't even try to see if it worked; assumed it did, although the plastic casing was badly cracked. The room was attended to every day, bed made, cleaned, new towels etc, and an extra pillow arrived quite soon after we asked for it. Breakfast was as expected, although one day, when it was busy, the room (being small) was difficult to manouvre past tables. The breakfast menu offered was typically European, as in not English, but it suited us -self service, cereal, fruit juice, coffee cheese, ham, toast ,breads etc The female member of staff gave the impression she woulkd rather be some where else though, but she was always busy, keeping the plates etc full. The guys on reception were always helpful when asked for information, and especially when we were trying to confirm our homeward flights and print boarding passes. We used the Hotel restuarant just once, on our last night in Rome. The young waiter here was superb! He spoke at least four languages, had a senese of humour and couldn't have been more helpful. I had been trying to find out where I could eat a particular dish in Rome called La pajata, which the receptionist hadn't heard of. I later found out that it has been widely discouraged and is rarely offered in restaurants anymore, and in any case, is usually found in more rural parts. The receptionist rang the chef there and then ( a lady, who did know of the dish), said she'd call back to confirm if she had the ingredients. She didn't, but offered some other delicacy I can't remember the name of, but it doesn't matter - the lady cooked something especially for me that wasn't on the menu, and was priced very reasonably. The hotel's location is a little way out from the centre of Rome, but we walked in every day. It's about 15-20 minutes to the Spanish Steps, half an hour to the Trevi fountain, Pantheon, Colloseo etc. The Vatican is walkable, but is over the river.....we walked back, but took a taxi there and arrived within 15 muinutes. I've given our view of the Hotel Priscilla, "warts and all". Don't be put off, by anything we;ve said, even if it sounds a little negative.......it's a budget, 3 star hotel, it's cheap, it's clean, it's got reliable staff, it's comfortable. A useful place to provide a bed for the night, a breakfast to start the day......and an excellent meal in the evening, if you want it.. We'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “not well”
Reviews.Author: Mioannis
Reviews.Content: When we arrived in hotel , the man of reception gave us a room which was room for one night stand ( just for little time,not to stay) it was dirty,the blanket had a hole from cigarette and everything there were dirty,the bathroom,the tapet,the fridge was destroyed and was smelling.everything.when we demanded to change room because we did not like it the receptionist told us to tell the morning to the other receptionist lies,that the room is not quiet and has lot of voice. Also he told us that if we tell the truth tha the room is dirty,the receptionist will not change it. We were very nervous and we liked to go to an other hotel but we terrified not to charge twice for a room. The other morning we told to receptionist to give us an other room because it was not quiet and he gave us an other room to the third floor.this room was very good and very clean. The breakfast was very poor but good. The first room

Reviews.Title: “Good base for exploring Rome”
Reviews.Author: JackCDublin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights, found it a good basic hotel, clean, friendly and a good base for getting around Rome, staff were helpful and friendly, breakfast was a typical continental buffet, small bar and restaurant that never seemed to be open. Irish bar across the road was ok for a quiet drink, would choose this hotel again if I decided to go to Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Good no-frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: rabcee
Reviews.Content: We used the Hotel Priscilla as a place to sleep during our short break to Rome. We didn't need lots of facilities. The hotel is fairly central. (10 min walk from Termini, 10 min from Spanish Steps) The staff are friendly, and their English is probably good enough that you could stay here without knowing any Italian. Our room was clean, with a comfortable bed, and new windows which had very good soundproofing. (Very handy, because the traffic is really noisy, even late at night.) The breakfast was fine: cereal, croissants(cornetti), rolls, juice. The machine coffee is rotten, but the waitress will make a cappuccino on request, or bring hot water for tea. For dinner, the restaurant is O.K., if undistinguished; there is a better restaurant just a few metres away. I would be happy to stay here again when we come back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't even give it a one star!!!”
Reviews.Author: n0thappyinr0me
Reviews.Content: We experienced a number of problems with our room at Hotel Priscilla. The air conditioning in our room was not working at all for one day (it was in August and the daily temps were over 40 degrees celsius) and this was extremely uncomfortable as we have 2 children. The staff could not care less. They stated that the people in our room prior to us had not complained and that the hotel was fully booked and we would not be able to change rooms. In addition to this our refrigerator was not working properly. We had gone to the supermarket and picked up some groceries like yogurt and cheese for the kids and they were about to spoil. Again the response to our complaint was that it was working properly. In addition to this there was no volume on the television for some channels. Our children were trying to watch cartoons and there was no volume on the channels that they wanted to watch. Again the staff insisted that everything was working fine. Please keep in mind that while were trying to resolve all of these issues we had wasted one day of our valuable vacation time. We were only in Rome for 3 nights and an entire day was wasted trying to have these problems resolved. On the final day we asked that we be allowed a late check out of an hour or two, however this request was refused. The staff could not care less as to how displeased we were and did nothing to try to rectify the situation. When we asked to speak with the owner or director of the hotel we were told they could not be contacted but that the director would arrive at the hotel between 1 and 2 p.m. on that day. We checked out of our room on time and left our luggage in your lobby which we trusted would be in safekeeping. We returned at around 2 p.m. only to be advised that the director was not coming in that afternoon and that she was never expected to come in that afternoon. Obviously we were told a lie just so that the employee of that morning could get us out of his hair. In addition to all of the above referenced problems we came to realize that some of our jackets which were in the outside pockets of our luggage were stolen during that time that they were in the lobby and under the so-called supervision of the employees. We e-mailed the owner about our complaints to which his reply was there were no problems with our room. We paid for an air conditioned room, with a working fridge and working television. We did not receive a room with air conditioning, working fridge or working television. We obviously did not get what we had paid for. The owner's response to our complaint was that he was sorry we didn't like the service. We will definitely not be staying at this hotel again and the only recommendation that we will give about this hotel is that we recommend no one stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sassboy
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean and I thought beds were comfortable, although my partner did not. Hot water not particularly powerful and bathroom small with a few hairs in the shower. True, the TV was small, the breakfast not great (although the lady serving it was brilliant) but the room was cool and not bothered by noise. The staff were v helpful, and Eduardo needs a special mention as he really is a great asset to the hotel. Very knowlegable. Cute too. Hotels in Rome are expensive so you pay for what you get and as we only paid 85 euros a night in June, thats exactly what we got. WiFi connection is really poor and my friends did not like the hotel at all. The triple room is good though.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Romacapoccia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Priscilla the last week of April 09. It's not a luxury hotel but is great for a vacation. Rooms were very clean and comfortable. The location is great we walked everywhere from the hotel. Breakfast was great, ( I actually miss the cornetti very much since I can't find them here in the states). The lady in charge of the breakfast also makes capuccinni, expressi, and hot chocolate if you ask. Also they do have a full bar in the evenings, and food on certain nights The staff was fantastic !! Can't wait to go back to Roma, and certainly will stay at The Priscilla again. Grazie a tutti at The Priscilla.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, everything else terrible!”
Reviews.Author: dawny_mc
Reviews.Content: I'd advise you not to stay at the Priscilla, the beds are rock hard meaning none of us had a decent night sleep. Also there were a few rugby fans staying who were running round corriders and despite complaints the staff did little about it. Definately not a 3 star hotel, more like a 1 or 2 - its quite far from main sites of Rome, with train station about a 20 min walk. Breakfast was ok, not great, the breakfast room was very cramped and squashed. Only plus point were the staff who were very helpful (apart from rugby fans incidence) and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Don´t go there”
Reviews.Author: JSDBrazil
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Rome. We stayed at the Priscila. We bought it as a three star hotel. For my surprise, here they claim to bem a 4 star!!!! Never! It´s not more than a 1 star hotel. We stayed at 2 star hotels much better than the Priscila for the same price. The rooms are terribly small, you can´t move, the shower is all wrong, the plastic box around the shower doesñ´t close properly. The staff was very friendly, that´s for sure. It was really disappointing. The tv is not more than 14 inches and it´s way up high in the room, which means you can´t see a thing.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but some problems!”
Reviews.Author: kari32323
Reviews.Content: I usually do not let these reviews persuay me unless completely terrible, but I think the management should know how we felt about our stay. My sister and I were in Rome for three days and had a wonderful time, other than our hotel stay. We are not picky people and usually will find the fun and good in all, but this was not happening at Hotel Priscilla. Good Points - very good sized room, very good sized bathroom, good location (nice Itialian eateries, and an absolutely beautiful church 2 minutes away). Bad Points - rooms not that clean, breakfast not great (but we made due), view from our room was looking down at all the dumpsters, and last and absolutely worst point was the staff. I have to tell you that I have travelled alot and encountered all types, Hotel Priscilla's staff has to be the absolute worst I have ever dealt with. Not only were they not helpful, in fact sent us in many a wrong direction, but they literally rolled their eyes and became annoyed with our questions. Very unfriendly and not helpful. I am quite sure that this is not the case with everyone and some may have encountered nice, courteous receptionist, but that was not our case! Unless staffing changes occur I will not recommend this place to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre place, iffy location”
Reviews.Author: DavidS13
Reviews.Content: The room here was okay, the location we didn't care for so much. A fair distance from Terminale train station, it was a long walk. Staff wasn't sympathetic that our tour was leaving prior to start of breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “More like 2 stars”
Reviews.Author: Zana23
Reviews.Content: My partner and I just got back from Rome, stayed in Priscilla hotel for 2 nights and we were very dissapointed with our room. It was small, dirty walls, very basic, noisy toilet.. breakfast was even more basic. Service very nice but that's about it. We boh travel a lot, stay in hotels anywhere from 3 - 5 stars, but this was really more like 2 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Lola006
Reviews.Content: Good location, good sized, basic accomodation but very quiet room, air con and fridge. Terrible breakfast - they give you American Coffee (even though they have a capucino machine) and on our second day, they could not provide hot water for a cup of tea!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good no frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: Craggyfergus
Reviews.Content: About twenty of us stayed in this hotel for my sisters wedding in Rome. It was near the church where she was getting married and there was a good irish bar across the road from the hotel. The hotel itself is fine and met our needs, how much time do you spend in a hotel anyway? It was clean and good value for money. The street however is very busy and looks a bit run down however there are some nice places to eat and drink nearby, its just a matter of exploring. There is a local pizzeria where i had the nicest pizza ever!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Good Location,”
Reviews.Author: satengkeef
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently visited Rome for the first time and stayed in the hotel Priscilla in Rome. I was very excited when I originally booked the hotel based on customer reviews on the website / travel site where I booked our Rome / Paris trip 6 months in advance. Later found trip advisor and read several of the reviews there and was very concerned. In the end after several calls to the agency at the last minute (less than 2 weeks) found that trying to rebook at a late date found very few available hotels and cancellation and new booking fees to be quite high. In the end decided to stick it out. I am very glad I put it to rest. While it is not the ritz , it was certainly clean. The room was quite large. the bathroom was clean and the bed very comfortable. Location was nice. walking distance to some street vendors, a major bus station to get you all over Rome. Walked to Trevi Fountain, Pantheon and Spanish steps. About 2-3 miles round trip I would guess. In essence, not a honey moon trip and not an exclusive, high end resort by any means. But a good value. No complaints. Breakfast room is clean, good food, great coffee latte.

Reviews.Title: “Warning!!!! Beware”
Reviews.Author: mollySanDiego
Reviews.Content: WARNING! This hotel will make unauthorized charges on your credit card. After doing so they barely communicate with you and refuse to return the money. I had to go through my bank to get my funds back!!!! I would not stay here. BEWARE.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here! 1 Star Not 3”
Reviews.Author: jackie1981
Reviews.Content: I looked at about 100 hotels when I tried to book this hotel, my fault I let some else book it for me because I was being overwhelmed with all the hotels in Rome. I should have went with my gut and got something better. If you are going to Rome for a trip suggest you spend some extra money and get a NICE hotel it will be worth it. Don’t even bother looking at anything under 200 euros. If you are like me this is a once in a life time trip and you want to enjoy it. Don’t stay here, there are so many hotels in Rome that are way nicer. And they way over charged. My Fiancé and I stayed here for two nights and it was hell. It ruined our trip to Rome. Our luggage was lost when we came over from Canada (we live in Ontario), we were staying near Naples and had to wait for the luggage, our reservations were early in our trip and we tried to cancel and they would not let us. We tried to explain that we have no luggage and we just wanted to move our reservation not cancel till the next week. They were rude and charged us a full night. We finally got there the next week and the hotel was very dirty, I don’t know who thinks that this hotel is clean, but it is not. Then there was no hot water and they were doing construction and it was very noisy. I got really mad and told them that they had a full week to inform me that there was no hot water and what do they expect us to do for three days, not shower!! So they told us that they were going to upgrade us to a apartment that they have a cross the street and it is way nicer than the hotel. NOT! This “apartment” looked like someone had just lived there, the Bath was full of hairs, and I mean full (not from your head). The drain was so full of hair it backed up when you showered. The bed was even grosser. It was swayed with lots of stains. There was no phone and it was about a two min walk from the hotel. We went back to the hotel and told them this was not okay. They did not care, they sent someone to clean it. All they did was rinse the bath out with water. The next day they told us they had a room for us at the hotel if we want. I told them I was mad and was not staying there unless the water worked and we would be able to sleep worth all the construction. He assured me that I would be able to use the hot water in the morning and that the water is just shut off of one hour in the middle of the night. Ya right! The room was not much better than the apartment was. At 7am the construction started right outside our room, they were literally taking a sled hammer outside our room and there was no hot water!!! In Canada this hotel would probably go for about $50 a night and it would not even be a one star. This hotel is not a three start, please go some where else.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: PleasedTraveler
Reviews.Content: We were thrilled with our stay at Hotel Priscilla. It was a great price and worth every penny. We were a little hesitant after reading some reviews prior to going to Italy, but we were glad we stuck with our reservation. Some complaints we read were regarding the small breakfast room, small room, bathroom, etc. However we enjoyed the breakfast each day we stayed and the room and bathroom were sufficient and clean (and great water pressure). Ronnie at the front desk was very helpful and friendly. The location was great too as it was near a major bus stop and within walking distance of the sights (and far enough away so get a peaceful night's sleep). We would definitely stay here again. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Great !”
Reviews.Author: xrkai
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and welcoming hotel situated on a main road located approx.10 minutes walk from the train station and Spanish steps. A quite walk to attractions such as the Vatican, but buses and trains ran frequently all week long. There are several busstops near the hotel. The room was without any complaints. It had an airconditioning (that worked very well,and was not noisy) and a television. After walking around Rome all day it was a good place to come back to and rest. We had a room at the front street that was a little bit noisy in the morning. So try to book a room in the back of the hotel if possible. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast had coffee or tea and orange juice, white bread, butter, marmalade and cheese. Quite enough for us anyway. A little warning though. The breakfast room was very small. So get there early, or you may have to wait for a seat. They also told us they will expand the breakfast room in 2008 so that problem will soon be gone. If you want to buy your own food there is a supermarket in the baselevel of Termini station and there is also a bigger supermarket on the way to Termini station in the corner of via Goito.

Reviews.Title: “Not Nice”
Reviews.Author: mollyann500
Reviews.Content: Don't bother with this hotel, there must be better 3 star hotels in Rome. The location is ok for the sites but on a very narrow road with lots of traffic. We had to keep our windows shut. The entire hotel needs a paint job inside. The walls of our room were very dirty however the bathroom and beds were clean. The beds were cots....no box springs. Lobby is dirty as is the front of the hotel. Breakfast was a joke.....coffee that tasted like instant, rolls and cheese. No cold cereal, toast, or fruit. The breakfast room is beyond tiny. While in Rome we saw many three star hotels that looked better, at least the lobby area was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: travel_bug000
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews, our party six stayed at the Priscilla for four nights. On arrival we were treated with distain by the day staff member and no assitance was provided in any way. Told that the elevator did not work, so had to carry bags to our rooms- only to find the elevator working minutes afterwards. One of the two rooms that we were provided with was unclean overall and had a double bed instead of singles we had requested. The next room was larger, but still not well maintained with small bathroom ( by European standards) and dirty. The noise from the rear lane continued until after midnight each night and we were awoken by the delivery and dump trucks doing their rounds in the early morning. The recommendations of the local restaurants by the hotel staff have to be viewed as suspicious after one was recommended and then after we ate there, we saw the same staff member coming back from the restaurant with his free meal. Not being naive, knowing that this goes on - still check out the look of the restaurants yourself. The breakfast room as stated in reviews is small with six tables X 2 people. The continental breakfast is adequate to start of your day only. We have travelled extensively and are not demanding in any sense of the word and rarely had anything to do with staff other than to greetings, but on the occasions we needed assistance or advice it was not provided. On one occasion we wanted to use an iron for clothing , asked for two days and given excuses, ect never got to use it. After four nights we had enough and moved out. The Hotel member on the day we checked out was rude and attempted to charge another 50 Euros for holding luggage for two hours in the luggage room after we had previously arranged it with no charge. My opinion is you can do a lot better than this place unless they upgrade the management of the Hotel and upgrade the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Magnifico”
Reviews.Author: 3sistersMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We arrived at night . The night manager was so helpful and we were so grateful. With our limited Italian, he spoke perfect english. He took the time to explain the do's and don'ts in Rome and the things to be careful of whilst we were sight seeing. He provided us with a map and showed us where all the sites were that we needed to see. He recommended a fantastic restaurant across the road where I ate the most delicious gnocci. As Rome is very large the hotel is well positioned . We found it very easy to get around on foot. Breakfast was fantastic. I would stay there again in an instant.

Reviews.Title: “Fair value.........”
Reviews.Author: Harmand
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay in the hotel, it is well situated for the city centre. Room was ok, staff helpful, only down point was the breakfast room which was a bit of a joke.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel staff were helpful and friendly the hotel was dirty, badly furnished and seemed more like a two or one star hotel. There is only one person in the front desk so there is no one to help with luggage. The rooms are old and musty and quite noisy because they face a busy street. The TV in the room only had two channels and there wasn't a fridge in the room which is standard in a three star hotel. The metro station was very far. We had to walk for over 15 minutes to get to the closest station. I would not recommend this hotel unless you have no other choice.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: SBH55
Reviews.Content: Unless you like the smell of mildew in your room, cracks in the walls, and mold on the carpet (YES - can you believe it!) you should stay far far away from this place. In addition the location is less than desirable - quite a walk from most of the major tourist sites (although with a pair of good shoes and some energy it can be done - but wouldn't suggest doing it alone at night - bit of a shady/deserted area). For the price there are a number of better places to stay in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “A dump”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We did not get the two twin beds we asked for. They were cots. The walls in the room were gouged and dirty, the walls had holes and the glass table top was cracked. The shutters were filthy. When we said the room was extremely noisy, the clerk said, "You didn't reserve a quiet room!" The worst part was finding a huge cockroach running around in the bathroom at 3AM. This place is dump. Don't stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Priscilla fine for a budget break”
Reviews.Author: maidmas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Priscilla for 3 nights in Feb and it was what we expected for a Hotel of that rating and price. Friendly, helpful staff, spotlessly clean rooms and lovely fresh rolls for breakfast with excellent English tea! True what others have said about the noise and the decor, but probably the same with many other similar Hotels and Rome IS noisy! La Baita around the corner (turn right outside door and then 1st right) serves good quality food at a very reasonable price in a lovely friendly family run style. On the street at back of Hotel, the Piccolo Abruzzo serves excellent food (no menu, just whatever is being cooked that day) but much more expensive. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Does exactly what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Priscilla is billed as a three star tourist hotel. The previous reviews posted were right in some respects (rooms at front are noisy) but way off in others. We have just returned from a four night break and have had no complaints whatsoever. The only thing I would say is the hot water takes a while to come through. However, once it does it is piping and plentiful. The staff were friendly and unobtrusive. The decor is a little tired (find me a hotel of this standard that isn't!) but the rooms, bathrooms and public areas were absolutely spotless. The breakfast room is tiny but breakfast can be served in your room at no extra charge. My dad was going to take just a coffee up to my mum one morning but the waitress insisted on taking her a tray including fresh rolls, various jams and cheeses plus said coffee. Avoid the American coffee and hot milk and ask for cappuccino. Tea and hot chocolate are also available on request. We can also recommend a cafe/bar across the road which serves an excellent coffee and sweet pastry for only one and a half euros. Several reviews have said that the hotel is a fair distance from the main tourist attractions. This is true but we found that we benefited from this in so far as the local restaurants and bars were more reasonably priced. The price we paid for an excellent quality meal with wine for four varied from between 65 and 100 euros. The Pizzeria La Baita which is just around the corner was particularly good. The hotel is a 15 minute walk (we timed it) from Termini station where you can catch the metro. However, we found that taxis were convenient, plentiful and surprisingly cheap. A taxi from the hotel to the Trevi fountain one evening was only 7 euros. In conclusion, I would not hesitate in recommending this hotel for a short break but, if you are bothered by traffic noise, do request a room at the rear.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!”
Reviews.Author: South1
Reviews.Content: Definately not a 3 star standard...more like a 2 star! Rooms were very basic but clean...one satellite channel..CNN! The continental breakfast consists of stale rolls and disgusting coffee from a machine! all provided in a tiny room. Don't stay here unless all you want is very basic and sparse accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Durty rooms and very small,pictures in internet do not match with the reality of the hotel, do not go there!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fine but a bit of a trek to the sites”
Reviews.Author: Blade77
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean, adequate and had very friendly and helpful staff. It was just that bit too far for an easy walk to the main attractions. I'd recommend heading a little closer to the Piazza Barberini. OUr room on the 1st flor was a little noisy though, especially the refuse truck which stopped off to do a pick up on the street at about midnight every night. If you do stay here I recommend the 'Andrea' restaurant a short walk away. Excellent food and service but pretty reasonable. The 'on the house' chocolates are superb.

Reviews.Title: “Priscilla is 3 stars at best.”
Reviews.Author: CurtisTalls
Reviews.Content: I'm not going to say this is a horrible hotel, because in all fareness it's not. It's very sub-par 3 star hotel. It's could be dealt a 2 star, and in fact I think most places rate it that. The hotel is in very bad need of a make over. The rooms are extremely bare and the hallways are in ruff shape. They had blankets draped over alot of the funiture and the elevator could barely fit my girlfriend and I. There's no vending machines in the hotel, so bring food with you, if not, you'll have to go to the front desk for a drink or out to a store. The bathroom was small but got the job done. The breakfast was no good, it was continental but the rolls were stale and the coffee was rubbish. We went to a restaurant near by for breakfast instead. The good things about this hotel are, it's cheap and very centrally located. It's 10 mins from Termini(Rail Station) and 10 mins to Piazza di Spagna(The Steps). If you're looking to save a buck and dont mind small euro hotels, it's great. I really wouldn't stay again, try looking for the Residenza Antica or the Capo D'Africa, they are much nicer and not too much more per night. Great restaurants near by are Alex Cafe on the Veneto and Cesarina! Curtis W/Travel Agent.

Reviews.Title: “Better ones out there”
Reviews.Author: Festnoz
Reviews.Content: The Priscilla was certainly clean and the staff was friendly enough, although they were unable to recommend any restaurants really in the city. The major issue we had was that the room was unbearably hot so we had to leave the window open at night. The hotel was on a bus route so the noise from the street kept us up in the wee hours. The shower ran from ice cold to scalding. On a more positive note, the breakfast was tasty and the location was fine. We could walk into the city center or take a bus or subway. Most likely there are similar hotels out there with better accomdations.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Rome”
Reviews.Author: DAndrews
Reviews.Content: stayed four nights at the Priscilla and yes it is in need of a makeover. the shutters are in danger of falling on a passer by and there was no fridge in the room, which was in need of decorating.Also it was rather cold on the first night but the porter obliged with an extra blanket.The breakfast is basic but adequate and we didn't have to wait too long to be seated. on the plus side it is reasonably priced and not to far away from the major attractions,also the local restaurants are more reasonably priced. i don't think this hotel is any noisier than any other hotel situated on a main street in Rome. hotel staff very helpful at all times. make sure you get hold of a good street map as soon as possible.( not available at hotel) Phonecard @ 5 euros gave 33 mins talk time to UK.

Reviews.Title: “Okay and expensive, but would not stay there again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Location was decent and within walking distance to shops and restaurants. The hotel and its rooms are old and haven't been kept in the best of shapes but the bed linens were clean. Towels were a bit scary as was the entire bathroom. Overall, if you just need an expensive bed and don't need the luxury or comforts of home, Priscilla is okay.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel....a little noisy though”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: An okay hotel, just on the fringes of the city centre itself, and near to some fab restaurants. Breakfast was acceptable, if a little predictable (croissant and roll every morning). Located on what seemed like a main road - very busy day AND night, so difficult to get a good night's sleep. Large bathroom in our room, but accommation overall could do with updating (our wardrobe door didn't shut properly, and there were a couple of interesting stains on our wall). The hotel was fine if you don't intend on spending much time there!

Reviews.Title: “It was average.”
Reviews.Author: vacationfan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Priscilla Hotel for four nights from July 2- July 6, 2005. The hotel is a 15 minute walk from the train station which was very manageable. Other than when we went to the Vatican (caught the bus at train station), we were able to walk to all of the major sights from the hotel. We stayed in room 55, which is on the first floor of the hotel. There was noise from the street but we could usually block it out with the air conditioner. The room was good sized with air conditioning and a bathroom with a shower. The bedspread and carpet were older and the walls were somewhat dirty and cracked. The bathroom shower curtain was gross, with mildew all over it. We tried to avoid touching it which is hard with a small shower. The breakfast room was small and a little cramped and we sometimes had to wait a short time for a table. The breakfast was rolls, a small piece of cheese and jams. You could order a cappuccino from the breakfast room staff who always seemed to be overwhelmed. The reception staff was polite but did not have any bus maps or information on tour companies or sightseeing. Overall, the hotel was adequate for the price we paid (102 Euro for a Saturday night, 86 Euro for weeknights).

Reviews.Title: “Clean but underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: FredPurdue
Reviews.Content: It was clean and had a reasonable breakfast without eggs, which earns two stars. Negatives were noisy location, hard beds, dimly lit room, all snow TV, and being far from anything. The location is just inside the wall and about ten minutes from the Villa Borghese. But all of the major tourist attractions are really distant, and the nearest underground stop is 15 minutes away. Cost of $200 plus per night.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Kate_Cold
Reviews.Content: We flew in to Rome Ciampino airport & the taxi to the hotel cost 55 euros. It cost us 35 euros going back. Upon arrival at the Hotel Priscilla we were pleased with the street, lobby & service. However, the room was a little disappointing with very old & grubby furniture & not much room to move around in. The staff were happy to provide breakfast to the room & a complimentary bottle of champagne for my partner's 30th birthday. The breakfast room itself was very small, although we didn't have any problems getting a seat on the 2 days we had breakfast down there. The location wasn't brilliant. I guess it is within walking distance of all the sights but in 30 degrees heat this wasn't such a good option for us! There is a bus service a short walk away (5mins max). The number 62 takes you to most of the tourist attractions, right across to Vatican City. However, this wasn't very frequent, we would guess about every half an hour. All in all the service was good but the hotel reception could not book us a taxi on our departure so we had to walk up to the local rank - only 2 mins away. We would definitely go back to Rome but would probably choose a different hotel. PS. Beware of the 'Gladiators' at the Colosseum, as soon as we got off of our bus they pounced. Posing for photo's & charging 10 euros!

Reviews.Title: “friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After visiting rome last year we decided to return to celebrate our first wedding anniversary with our parents. We read the reviews on this hotel which seemed fine so booked well in advance. We were not let down. The hotel is centrally situated, is very basic but immaculatey clean and the staff are probably the most helpful, friendliest people we have ever come across.They advised us on places to eat out at night (La Baita) on Via Luciana was excellent value for money and again very friendly and only 40m from the hotel. The breakfast room is very small but we were told that they are extending next year. We would definately spend another break in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Could try harder....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We returned Thursday after 3 nights and 4 days. The hotel is sweet and reasonably priced in a good location for walking around to see the city. However there were several frustrating things especially having to always ask for things more than once. Each night we ordered breakfast in our rooms for the following morning but it was forgotton about on each of the last 2 days. This made us late for the taxi on the last day. The fridge didnt work and there was no plug in the bath, making it very difficult to bath our babies. They didnt put a cot in the room even when reminded upon arrival. They were nice, friendly staff and we wanted them to succeed. Our holiday wasn't ruined - we had a lovely time - but on balance the hotel was disappointing considering the other reviews we had read on this web-site and its relative ranking. Don't let me put you off, but be prepared for 1 or 2 disappointments.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: justsaygo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and another couple just returned from rome where we spent 7 nights at the Priscilla Hotel. We booked this room via Orbitz (85E/night) & we were very pleased with our rooms. It's not the Ritz & it could use a fresh coat of paint in some places, but the location is wonderful in a lovely neighborhood with restaurants, shops, cafes & bus stops nearby. (metro was an easy 1/2 mile walk) Our friends' room had a queen-size bed + a twin bed (white bedspreads & walls) & although the bathroom was quite large the shower-stall was small. Our room was smaller by comparison (peach colored walls, tan & white bedspread), but our bathroom had a full tub/shower combination. Both rooms and baths were clean and comfortable. The breakfast was fine, with cappucino & tea available on request. The staff is wonderful! They helped us with dinner reservations, calling cabs, explaining which bus to ride and where to get the bus! Danielli even interpreted for me when I was arranging a meeting with a family friend. The only problem we had was loud music coming in through the courtyard on Fri & Sat nites which interrupted my sleep 1st nite and hubby's the 2nd nite. It was not a guest, but either the sports bar or an individual in an apt (never did figure out which!) Would we stay here again? Definitely Yes!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near Villa Borghese”
Reviews.Author: AlwaysTraveling15
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Priscilla Hotel as one of the chaperones of a group of developmentally disabled adults. I'm writing this review because I regularly receive emails from the familly members of developmentaly disabled individuals requesting information on hotels that will accommodate people with special needs. Everyone in our group was able to walk, however, so this is not necessarily for people in wheelchairs. The hotel has stairs from the street level to the lobby and main floor, but there is an elevator and several guest rooms are on the main floor. The Priscilla Hotel was wonderful to our group. They were friendly, helpful, and respectful of everyone in our group regardless of their disability. The breakfast was fresh, tasty, and plentiful. The regular coffee was awesome and they would make cappuccinos on request. The rooms are spacious and clean, but the bathrooms are small. The location is excellent. The hotel is within walking distance of many major attractions. Even with our slower moving group, we were able to easily walk to most major attractions. The metro line to the Colosseum and the Vatican is just a few blocks away. But, we walked back to the Priscilla from the Vatican and the Colosseum. The neighborhood is safe and there are several inexpensive restaurants and grocery stores nearby. If you are looking for a clean, friendly, inexpensive hotel in a great location in Rome, the Priscilla is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Just the job for a short break”
Reviews.Author: jacksj
Reviews.Content: We looked for a hotel close to the centre of Rome but at a reasonable price. I spotted this one from the other user reviews in Tripadvisor and we weren’t disappointed. The room was basic but all you need for a short break. They could do with redecorating but I think that they may be doing that. Good value at 210 euros for three night in a double The Hotel is 10 mins from the Metro and 15 to 20 mins walk from the major tourist sites. Breakfast was simple and served in a small room of reception. You can have breakfast in your room at no extra charge. The staff are very welcoming, helpful and knowledgeable. There are loads of places to eat within 200 to 300 m of the Hotel. We enjoyed the Val di Sangro Tratitorria in Via Alessandro. We would use this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. It was simple but clean. The room was a good size and the shower room looked quite new. The TV in the room picked up CNN and BBC World news so we could keep updated. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We could buy tickets at reception for one of the open top bus tours of the city which was helpful. They also organised a car to take us back to the airport (ciampino) which had a set fee of 40 euros much cheaper than the 60 euros we paid to get to the hotel from the airport. The location was good, definitley within walking distance of spanish steps and trevi fountain although some of the roads around were quite quiet and dark when walking back at night.
